context.p: In many cases, the IHTSDO Workbench will have the Classifier setup already in-place as "Run Classifier" under the Tasks menu. Where installations don't have access to the classifier plugin via the main menu, here is a brief outline of the steps needed to set up (or, to review settings for) the IHTSDO Workbench to run the built-in classifier against editing changes that have been made to a terminology:

step.cmd: Set up the "Edit Path" using the Preferences Panel as outlined in Setting Classifier Preferences.
step.stepxmp: Use the "New Path" tab to establish the new edit path:-

step.cmd: Create a "Classify Path" using the Preferences Panel.
step.stepxmp: Return to the "New Path" of the Preferences Panel, create another path for the classifier...

stepresult.p: Review the path settings under the Preferences "Path" Tab. Only the "Edit Path" should have "Edit on this path" checked. Both the "Edit Path" and "Classifier Path" should have the "Use position in view" checked.
The resulting paths should look similar to the following in the Terminology Auxiliary hierarchy in the taxonomy panel ...

fig.title: Path settings displayed in the Taxonomy view

step.cmd: Set up the 5 Classifier parameters using the Classifier Tab of the Preferences Panel
step.stepxmp: Navigating to the appropriate terms in the taxonomy view, drag and drop the following concepts to their respective targets in the classifier preference pane.
